intro: Stilpnopappus speciosus, commonly known as the showy pappus plant, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive bracts. The plant produces showy yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically narrow and grass-like, while its stems are erect and often hairy. Stilpnopappus speciosus is adapted to arid environments and thrives in well-drained soils.
